document_title: Streptococcal arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Streptococcal arthritis often appears after damage to the skin or some nearby organs or sepsis. The main causes of the disease are: (3)
Mechanical agents: skin damage, joint injury, open joint capsule tears will create conditions for bacteria from the outside to penetrate the joint.; Infections appear next to the joints such as boils, tendonitis, muscle inflammation, bone inflammation, urinary tract infections, digestive tract infections or genital infections near the joints... These are factors that directly affect development. streptococcal arthritis; The patient has had arthrocentesis or joint injection procedures performed without proper technique or sterility.; Due to infections in other organs such as pneumonia or sepsis, bacteria travel through the bloodstream to the joints.
In addition, the disease is also common in subjects such as:
People with poor resistance and are susceptible to infections such as children, pregnant women, and the elderly.; People with diabetes; People with malnutrition; People with bone and joint diseases such as joint injuries, gout, rheumatoid arthritis, etc.
